content.description: Start sitting with your LH on an undercling and your RH on a small crimp, make a hard move to a sloper, then climb through easier terrain to the top.
content.location: This is located on the Woodlouse Hunter Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on small, left hand crimp and an even smaller crimp right next to it, punch to the slopers, and then top out on crimps.
content.protection: 2 pads, the smaller ones are easier to fit into the landing.
content.location:
This is located on the Woodlouse Hunter Boulder, about 100 yards to the right of

Point Break

. The top of this boulder can be seen from

Point Break

.

climbs.name: The Widowmaker
climbs.fa: Skyler Bol & Mike Englestad on TR

content.description: Atop the massive hill where both the Electric Ocean and Widowmakers can be found is a hidden gem of the Poudre. Perched on a small, 8 foot wall is this gorgeous boulder. Start with powerful compression on edges up the arete. Turn the bulge, and enjoy the balancy crimps to a wild last move. This is stuck in between being a route and a boulder problem, but with a hard upper section, bolts seemed like the best option.
content.protection: 4 bolts and walk off back of boulder. It could be bouldered?
content.location: This is above both the Widowmakers and Electric Ocean. The best approach is to follow cairns up the hillside to the Scarbanzo Boulder. The Widowmaker is only slightly further up the hill.

content.description: Climb the sloper rail system traversing right to a crux move at the end.
content.location: This is located in the Royal Boulders. The easiest access is to hike to second entrance near the bridge, and they are the first cluster of boulders you see.

content.description: Stand start on a bad undercling and left hand crimp. Climb 3 thrutchy moves, then top out.
content.location:
This one is a little more tricky to find. It is located about 100 yards to the right from

Devil Wears Lace

Boulder.

content.description: Climb the massive boulder through the center of the face with a flat landing on a large rock, but on either sides of the small landing is a pit. This is a serious highball.
content.location: This is located in the Royal Boulders. The easiest access is to hike to second entrance near the bridge, and they are the first cluster of boulders you see.

climbs.name: The Squeeze Box (submitted as The Widowmaker)

content.description: Stand start on good crimps, and work up the face to a crux reaching back over the lip.
content.location: This is located on the Blackwidow Boulder at the beginning of the talus field.

content.description: Start on good left hand crimp and a decent right hand sidepull. Dyno for the lip, then top out.
content.location:
This is located right behind

Le Don

.

content.description:
Start the same as for "

Devil Wears Lace

," but head left through big moves.
content.location:
It is in the same location as the

Devil Wears Lace

.

content.description: Squat start on crimps, dyno over the bulge, then complete a tough mantel.
content.location:
This is in the French Boulders. It is located on the same boulder as

Le Don

.

content.description: Start on the two jugs, and move through compression moves to the top. Exit right for full value.
content.location:
This is 100 yards below

Le Don

and is located just off the road. The easiest way to find this boulder is to hike 100 yards further down the canyon from the normal talus entrance and hike up though this entrance next to the bridge.

content.description: Climb through crimps to compression moves up high.
content.location: It is located about 3/4 the way up the hill.

content.description: Stand start on the very small crimp rail in the middle race, and make a few hard moves to get into a massive dyno.
content.location:
This is at the Royal Boulders! It is located on the same boulder as

Bone Tomahawk

.

content.description: Stand start, and climb up the slab trending slightly left.
content.location:
This is in the Royal Boulders! just up from

Convergence

on a huge boulder with many slab faces.

content.description: Start matched in the broken quartz seem, Move left LH to the lip, then work though small crimps to a hard mantel.
content.location:
This is just off the road located just before

Slap Happy

.

content.description: Start on a terrible, left hand crimp and a decent, right hand undercling. Bump through slopers, grab another undercling, and then hit the lip. The sit start is still a project.
content.location:
This is located on the Point Break Boulder, just around the corner from

Devil Wears Lace

.

content.description:
Pink Panther is the sit down start for

Point Break

.
content.location:
It is located behind

Devil Wears Lace

on the Point Break Boulder.

content.description:
Start on the same holds as

Brown Recluse

, but head right using toe hooks and campusing. Get the good holds on the slab, and bust a tricky mantle.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder as

Brown Recluse

.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a large jug and your right hand on a sidepull, throw toe hooks, and traverse right into a crux throw to a jug.
content.location:
It is located right behind

Le Don

.

content.description: Start sitting on the compression feature, climb up and left to a crux reach out to a crimp, then make a large move to a jug, and top out to the left.
content.location: This is roadside underneath the Royal Boulders and is located just next to the bridge.

content.description: Start under the roof on opposing crimps, work a few moves out the roof, then traverse left along good holds.
content.location:
It is on the same boulder as

Point Break

.

content.description: Stand start on to the slab, and work straight up the face, trending left for the topout.
content.protection: 3 pads, 2 to fill in a gap in the landing.
content.location:
This is 50 yards to the right of

Around The World

.

content.description: Start on around The World (sitting matched on the sloper), then climb up the large jug under the roof. From here, head left, and climb straight over the roof.
content.location: This is on the Around the World Boulder.

content.description: Start on the good crimp rail, and pull a hard mantel onto the slab. Climb the slab, then complete a much more delicate second mantel.
content.location:
It is very close to the road, right next to

Slap Happy

.

content.description:
Squat start on good LH crimp and a white RH incut on the crazy compression feature. Climb up and left using crimps and sidepulls, then huck for the sloper lip, and top out. This is the best line at the Widowmakers.

Starting on the lowest holds (LH on a small notch and RH on a bad sloper) adds 3 hard moves into Le Don and is called Don Quixote, V9, FA: Sam Rothstein.
content.location:
It is on the large and obvious boulder about 50 yards up and to the right from the

Undergun

Boulder. This is large white arete that can be seen from lower in the talus. This boulder is located in the center of the French area.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious rail, and make tension moves on crimps out the roof.
content.location:
This is located on the backside of the Point Break Boulder, starting left of

Pink Panther

.

content.description:
Start on

Raven

, and do the same first 2 moves. Then head right, and top out.
content.location: This is on the Raven Boulder in the Royal Cluster.

content.description: Start on the jug undercling, and move through crimps to tough press move near the top.
content.location:
This is located just left of

Le Don

in the French Boulders.

content.description:
Stand start on two very small incut crimps, throw a toe hook on the arete, move right, then finish

Le Don

.
content.location:
This is located on the

Le Don

Boulder in the French Boulders.

content.description: Climb the crazy compression feature that juts out of the hill.
content.location: It is all the way at the top of the hill!

content.description: Start on the massive fang jug, then climb straight up the face topping out on the tallest part of the boulder.
content.location:
This is located on the Black Widow Boulder right at the start of the talus.  This is boulder "B" on the

topo

.

content.description: Start sitting with a jug LH and a small sidepull for the RH, press into the drop knee, and make two very hard slaps to get into good slopers, then traverse left to top out.
content.location: This is on the Woodlouse Hunter Boulder.

content.description: Start on the jugs with a heel, and climb up and right through small crimps to gain the lip.
content.location:
It is located on the large boulder just up and right from the

Black Widow

highball.

content.description: Stand start, and climb the slab with the crux near the top.
content.location:
This is located on the backside of the

Le Don

Boulder in the French section.

content.description: Start matched on the obvious jug rail at the bottom, then climb the crack feature using jams and underclings.
content.location:
It is at the same elevation as the

Around The World

boulder, but continue past for 50 yards.

content.description: Start on a good left hand crimp and right hand sidepull. Move out the corridor then up and left to top out.
content.location:
It is located 30 yards below

Le Don

in the French Boulders.

content.description: Stack pads to start on two extremely small incuts, dyno out left to a good hold, and top out.
content.location: This is located in the Royal Boulders. The easiest access is to hike to second entrance near the bridge, and they are the first cluster of boulders you see.

content.description: Stand start on the middle of the slab, and climb straight up using crimps and sidepulls to reach the crux at the top (20 feet).
content.location: This is at the Royal Boulders! It is just up from The Throne and the massive Slab Boulder.

content.description: Start low on the jug system, move into a crimp then a small pinch and fire for the lip. The stand start is V8. FA: Brett Hoffman.
content.location: This is located in the Royal Boulders. The easiest access is to hike to second entrance near the bridge, and they are the first cluster of boulders you see.

content.description: On the west side of the Point Break boulder is this slightly overhung face with a band of rock sticking out underneath. Start matched on a flat edge, and dyno to the lip, using the band of rock underneath for feet. Watch the swing on this one.
content.location: This is on the West face of Point Break Boulder with a built-up landing beneath it.

content.description: Start on a good LH crimp and a RH sidepull. Pull one move out left, then swing the feet over, and grab the lip.
content.location:
It is located just up and left from the

Black Widow

highball boulder.

content.description: Climb through crimps on the prow to an easy but fun topout.
content.location:
It is located 20 yards below

Le Don

in the French Boulders.

content.description: Check out the video beta on the Widowmaker's homepage.
content.protection: A few pads for the start.
content.location: It is on the first boulder you come upon on from the trail.

content.description: Stand start on the large jug feature, and climb up the slab topping out at the peak of the boulder.
content.location:
This is in the Royal Boulders! on the same boulder as

The Rook

but just to the right.

content.description: Start on a LH undercling and right slopey crimp, bump twice, match, then grab a crimp on the slab, and surf out to jugs.
content.location: This is located on the Brown Recluse Boulder at the start of the talus.

content.description: Do a low start on a compression feature, pull on, and throw a high right heel hook, hit a crimp, then cross to the jug sidepull. Find the hold around the arete, then head left to top out.
content.location: 3 quarters of the way up the hill, hike up to the Electric Ocean Wall by the trail on the left side of the talus. When you near the top, one monster boulder will be off to your right. Bean Juice sits on top of the huge monster boulder.

content.description: Start low matched on the sidepull sloper, trend left to the large, sidepull jug, then head back right though a crimp rail at the lip.
content.location: This is on the first boulder you approach from the hike in.

content.description:
Start matched on the crimp rail above the rock, crank a super high right foot, and cross to a terrible RH crimp. Then bust left to undercling, and throw again to jug sidepull. Climb the jug system to the top from here.

Arachnid Direct (V8) goes straight up the face.
content.location:
This is just left of

Arachnaphobia

on the

Devil Wears Lace

boulder.

content.description: Start sitting on the rock with two good opposing crimps, make a large move to gaston, then hit a crimp rail, and gun for the top.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder as

Devil Wears Lace

.

content.description:
This ascends the obvious arete imediately behind and left of

The Widowmaker

. Parallel rails on either side of the arete make for some cool compression. It is a good warm-up for

The Widowmaker

.
content.location:
It is atop the hill behind

The Widowmaker

.
